Reviews.Title: “My review- i thought it was brill”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca W
Reviews.Content: The staff are very helpful and speak good english aswell as french. Your bags are collected as you enter the hotel. The bathroom is really nice and the bed is the comfiest bed i have ever slept in! The decor is elegant and the hotel is in a brilliant location. It is close to the chanse elysees (you know what i mean) and is surrounded by amazing shops, the arc de triomphe and restaurants. I reccomend chez andre which is opposite the hotel (a french restaurant with nice fish and meat dishes) and the hippopotomas (which is further up the chanse elysees towards the arc de triomphe but still in walking distance. There was a beautiful view and the staff were always willing to help. I rated it 5 stars because everyting is so immaculate. The breakfast was brilliant with a wide selection

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience during our first trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: gizmo621
Reviews.Content: We cannot say enough about the elegance, the cleanliness, and the helpful staff at the Hotel Franklin Roosevelt. My wife and 2 best friends and I just got back from a few days in Paris. The Hotel Franklin Roosevelt is a gem with so many great points. First, it is located just a brief walk from the Champs-Elysees. Second, the staff was phenomenal. Each staff person we encountered was very courteous and helpful. The hotel features an extensive and impressive breakfast buffet common in many European hotels as well as a cozy little bar that's a great stopping off place before venturing out for the evening. In the weeks before our trip, I exchanged emails with the staff with various questions that my group had, all of which were answered promptly and courteously. Lastly, the hotel is very elegant looking and extremely clean. I would highly recommend this for anyone making their first (or repeat) trip to Paris. We will certainly be back here again.

Reviews.Title: “If it's in your budget, this is a fantastic place to stay. Junior suite is perfect if travelling with an infant.”
Reviews.Author: Bluenoser794
Reviews.Content: This was a really well put together hotel. The room (had a junior suite) was wonderful. As parents travelling with a one-year old, the room's layout was perfect (room 62). As it was a junior suite the living room area and bedroom area were just separate areas of one large room. What made it perfect was that there was a small hallway included inside the suite with a few closets; the perfect size for the travel cot. When the little one fell asleep Mum and Dad could still drink some wine, listen to music and look at the Eiffel Tower out of the rooms window. The room and hotel felt luxurious (will not nit-pick between 4 or 5 stars). The staff was very friendly and courteous, and prompt with any request. It was pricey, but made our weekend in Paris very enjoyable. I would highly recommend this to anyone travelling with a very young child and wanting to still feel like they're having a romantic holiday once it's the little one's bed time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic gem in a beautiful and quietly located street in the 8th”
Reviews.Author: ladywithbaby
Reviews.Content: A small but very well formed hotel with everything one could want. I stayed for work and was very happy with my room, facing the courtyard it was extremely quiet and a great rest. The bed was superb, everything was very clean and high quality, Wifi worked instantly, breakfast buffet was bountiful and cheerful staff delivered on everything for every request I had. I will be back with my husband next time to enjoy the area properly, the best shopping and close to Champs Elysees and Grand Palais museums/fairs.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with nice location”
Reviews.Author: Vereshchagin
Reviews.Content: Good 4 star hotel with excellent location by the shopping street and in walking distance from very center of the city. There are some very nice french restaurants by the hotel, metro station is in 5 minutes walking distance. I can recommend this hotel to stay, the price was reasonable (for the Paris, comparing with other hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Charming French Hotel with wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Southern_Belle815
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at the FDR in August. We loved it. It was odd to note that many Parisians were gone on their own vacations and had locked up their businesses in the area. But there were plenty of tourists so the city did not feel deserted. The hotel itself is in a fabulous location. We walked everywhere. It was clean and tasteful. The walls were covered in fabric. So charming. We rented two rooms. Our bed was comfortable. We had no view - we were on the interior of the hotel. But there was nice sunlight coming in and it was fine. Our children had a view of the city street and the restaurant. They enjoyed that. We had a nice bathroom, but the 2nd bathroom had an odd little half wall instead of a shower curtain. It didn't keep the water inside the tub, so that was a bit of an inconvenience. (Water everywhere) As others have commented, the breakfast was plentiful and delicious. We even took fruit with us for the day and enjoyed having a snack for later. That was helpful in Paris, because it was extremely expensive to eat in this area of the city. I called it a "viewing fee". If you could view the Eiffel Tower - you paid a premium price for everything to eat or drink. So anything withing walking distance was very pricey. In neighborhoods farther away - dining and drinking were more reasonable. - but then there was the taxi fare. Oh well - just know before you go. My techno savvy son was not too impressed with the internet connection available in the "business center". It was an extremely small phone booth in the basement area. That wasn't great, but maybe it limited his screen time, which is a good thing. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff was helpful. The facility is lovely, clean, comfortable, safe and convenient. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pauline_jones21
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Paris at the lovely Franklin D Roosevelt Hotel. Lovely smart building and very professional staff. Our room was lovely and clean and beatifully decorated. The location is good just a short walk to the Champs Elyees. We would certainly stay here again, the breakfast was really good, plenty of choice and good quality food with friendly staff. The only problem we had was finding suitable restaurants in walking distance that weren't fully booked. Chez Andre across the road was very busy and when we managed to get a table we were pinned up against a wall with people on the next table virtually touching us! The starter was OK but the main course was very poor just a peice of lamb with mashed potatoes and with two drinks it cost 86.00 euros! OK we expected to pay big money in Paris but also expected good food we would have happily paid more if it had been excellent. I thought the French could cook! We wanted a nice relaxing meal but the service was so quick almost thrown at us and we were out within 25 minutes! Stay away! Walk a bit further or get a taxi and go to the Champs Elyees.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: lulumommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a very pleasant stay at this hotel. We have been to Paris numerous times and try to stay in a different area each time we visit. We were there in August which is an interesting time to be in Paris: few Parisians, many tourists, many restaurant closings but easier to get in to those places that are open, a lot calmer than other times of the year. The hotel location was wonderful, away from the major tourist areas like Marais. Latin Quarter and St. Germain but still in walking distance to Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides, Musee Branly, Champs Elysees, Avenue Montaigne, the Seine. Also near Metro and Batobus stops. Very much a neighborhood rather than a tourist hub. Nice to return to at the end of a busy touring day. Our room was pretty large by Parisian standards, with a comfortable sleeping area and a separate dressing area. The bath was smallish but very adequate. Very clean, nicely decorated, comfortable beds, and very quiet even though the hotel was full and we had babies next door. Staff was friendly, spoke English, and most pleasant. Only complaint was that the lobby bar was not open which may have been due to the time of year. Not a problem since there were cafes and restaurants within walking distance. Would definitely consider returning here upon our next trip. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel found through Groupon, great location”
Reviews.Author: Youngtravellincouple
Reviews.Content: We got the Groupon deal for Two Night Paris Break For Two Including Bottle Of Chablis and River Cruise Tickets for £339 - which was very good value. I believe that the normal value of this would have been £733. We had a slight hiccup on arrival as the receptionist informed us that we had booked incorrectly. I had booked through the website, as advised when I called the hotel. She did acknowledge that this was their fault rather than ours, but made us feel a little sheepish nonetheless. She eventually found us an available room and said that it wasn't ready but they would call us when it was - which she never did. Apart from this, our stay was very pleasant and I have no further complaints other than the poor hairdryer and slightly small double bed. The location is fantastic, the rest of the staff were very friendly and helpful, and our room had lovely Juliette balcony windows opening over a pretty street. The area it is in is also really smart, and there are some good local restaurants and bars. I would go back here and would also recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: MHadi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is overpriced for what it is, but the location is excellent. It is off the Champs-Elysee in a quite and safe side-road, making walking easy. The hotel is elaborately decorated and clean with good service. Politeness of the front-desk is so-so, not rude but not very friendly either. Breakfast was excellent though (food in Paris is generally excellent). Yes, stay here if you can afford it, as overall it is a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a PRIME Paris location”
Reviews.Author: Dmac16
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel from 7/23-7/26 2011 with my wife and two teen-aged sons. We booked 1-double room and 1-twin room. The rooms were very large by european/Parisian standards. Our double room faced the street and had a small balcony that was large enough to sit and enjoy a glass of wine after a great day of sightseeing. The room had a the equivalent of a queen sized bed, and a large bathroom with a full tub/shower enclosure. The room was very nicely appointed, the furnishings were in excellent condition. Satellite TV was provided and many english speaking sports and news channels were offered. Free WiFi is also provided. The Hotel offers a hot "American" breakfast, and a very nice variety of pastries, fruit, cereals and cheeses. The breakfast can be booked in conjunction with your room for a modest charge (recommended), or you can add it on daily at the cost of 25Euro (a bit $$$ by US standards). There are several nice Cafes and Pastry shoppes within 1 block of the Hotel. This was GREAT way to end a two week vacation to France for our family. I was able to book online directly through the Hotels website and with advance planning we were able to secure an excellent discounted rate. Finally, the staff was very courteous and professional, always offering a warm welcome, and very thoughtful with their suggestions for dinner and tour itineraries for our family. We will definitely be back, Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Duth
Reviews.Content: Hotel lovely, had a triple room (kingsize bed and long length sofa bed, both were very comfortable (rm 49) windows opened onto an internal area, no view but it was very quiet. There was air con and also heating to choose from in the room (it rained the whole week but was warm for walking around in), umbrellas were at the hotel lobby for all to borrow or you could buy one at the supermarket for 4 euros, this store was great for wine, crisps, toiletries, etc - reasonable prices for Paris. Breakfast was continental style, good and plenty of it. do take a french phrase book with you as english is spoken but mostly French. Metro was handy 12.50 euros for 10 tickets or 1.75 euro for one. Taxi from CDG airport was 55 euros to the hotel and same back with another company. Restaurants were quite hard to find, a good, inexpensive meal. D.alsace was on a corner of the Champs Elysee and did a fixed price menu, the food was quite good here but pricey for some I had the rib eye steak (35 euros) and the english menu was more expensive than the french one, ask for both for the translation but the french one for the price, but our best meal was at Bileboude on rue exposition (check on internet correct details) 33 euro for 3 courses, good quality but more nouvelle cuisine sized portions. (this was across bridge from grand palace towards eiffel tower and along 4 streets) but prebook closed on sundays. Icecream across bridge from notre dame is very good Berthillion (looks like normal icecream but had the hazlenut one it was creamy and delicious) La douree bakery on champs elysee is over rated, very posh tea room but just okay. Pauls bakery on Champs Elysee is double the price than the others around Paris and when ordering your sandwich check your phrase book so you know your order as only french was spoken here. (sometimes pointing isn.t good enough). Hotel was an oasis at the end of the day, clean, warm and fresh sheets every day. Well done to the staff here they do a great job and if I am every in Paris again I will be back here.. Free internet in room.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: lolo1408
Reviews.Content: we had a superior room here and was very pleased with the size of the room given the horror stories we had read for other hotels. It was on the back of the hotel so very quiet. Good closet space and a big deep bath with a very efficient shower. The staff were pleasant and very helpful. The breakfast was excellent, with a good variety of fresh fruit and yoghurts as well as cereals, meats, and hot food. The location was great. Two metro stations within 10 minute walk, you are on the Seine within 10 minutes and a couple of minutes onto the Champs Elysees. You are surrounded by restaurants, which was useful given we had tired legs from lots of walking and very wet from all the rain. They are pricey so be prepared. But to explain the area you are in one one corner is a Truffle shop on the other is a cavier shop, next door to the hotel there is a Bordeaux specialist wine shop. There is a beautiful deli, and other good wine shops near by. Apart from the very English desire to have tea making facilities, this hotel suited us very well. It was very civialised with check out by 12pm and breakfast served to 12pm. Would happily return

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Old World charm, warm decor, wonderful breakfast room, bountiful breakfast, room comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jdlasser
Reviews.Content: Spent New Year holiday in Paris at this lovely hotel in perfect location, across street from 5 star restaurant, 2 short blocks off Champs d'E...staff reserved, but polite; gorgeous chocolate truffles at front desk! Room dark (faced walls) but spent little time in room - it's Paris, after all! Bathroom very good, great closet space, very clean. Bar and lounge comfortable, cozy library, plush, great place to meet other world travellers. Internet access in cramped old phone booth downstairs. Bountiful breakfast in charming Morning Room, hand-painted garden scene murals. This was booked by my Londoner friend's English agent and I recommend it to my fellow American travellers. Planning to stay at FDR Hotel again this Autumn and make it our special little place in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: wychwood100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a Travel Zoo deal which included a free upgrade. Hotel room on 5th floor was light and airy with a small balcony overlooking the street and was clean and nicely furnished with a very comfortable bed. The ensuite was well lit, and large. The Hotel staff were pleasant and helpful, lending us an hotel umbrella for the day when rain was forecast and storing our bags after we checked out until it was time to go to the airport. Breakfast was good & was served until mid-day so no rush for the clients, but a different story for the staff who were rushed off their feet but still polite. Hotel location was great & very handy for Champs Elysees. There are several restaurants close by which was good as our feet were sore as it is a walking city! One was called Le Relais Entrec and served steak & chips and there were always people queuing outside. Service was good & quick. The other was called Chez Andre and was also good. On arrival, we took the guide book advice and travelled by train from the airport into Paris, and then on the metro which took ages & involved lugging suitcases up & down hundreds of staircases. On the way back we took a minibus which can be arranged through hotel and which was far more convenient. Great hotel and would definitely go back with Travel Zoo but not at the rack rate!

Reviews.Title: “great choice in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: colinkath084
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights for a Special Anniversary. In Paris you need to walk to appreciate the wonderful architecture and interesting shopping opportunities and this hotel was ideally suited for many of the major sights and attractions too, and quite near the Champs Elysees. The staff were very friendly and welcoming, the room was comfortable (great bed) and quiet too, the breakfast really superb with a huge variety for every taste- this went on until 12.30 so there was no rush in the morning- and within a few steps of the Hotel there was an impressive choice of very good restaurants for dinner in the evening. This was important because our feet were very tired by the time we got back to the hotel in the late afternoon and we couldn't be bothered walking miles to find an eating place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great staff and breakfast - a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Deb49d
Reviews.Content: We took a trip to this hotel on a TravelZoo offer, it was great value and all worked out perfectly. The staff were excellent, rooms clean and tidy, breakfast plentiful and all went without incident. The hotel is in a great location, plenty of great restaurants around and within easy walking distance of many great sights. Nice and quiet though so peaceful. I would love to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a super area.”
Reviews.Author: CrestaRider
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in February and enjoyed every moment. Our room (55) faced an internal courtyard and was the quietest I've ever slept in. The bathroom is large, the shower powerfull, and the double sinks a joy. My wife found the bed a bit hard, but she found a matress topper in the wardrobe which solved the problem. The breakfast was good - and included in the Travelzoo deal which is very good value. This is one of those hotels that you really look forward to returning to after a day's sightseeing. It's convenient for the Metro, and there's plenty of local restaurants. Do be aware that Paris is unbelievably expensive at the moment. A couple of beers will cost you €16 to €20 in the grubbiest of establishments, the cheaper restaurants are usually packed, particularly if they have a good reputation. The exhorbitant ones are empty and off-putting. The 'Relais d'Entrecote' along the street is an experience, the queue dies down around 10:30! Oh - and the hotel staff are the best.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful and a very good deal”
Reviews.Author: WandererLondon
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a great stay at the Franklin Roosevelt having found a great deal on travelzoo. Lovely, spacious, clean rooms and charming staff. We particularly liked the fact that breakfast is served until 12.30 - perfect for weekend stays when you don't want an early start! We were able to check out as late as we wanted as well which was also great. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, very Parisian and superbly located”
Reviews.Author: RonnieLC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in a junior suite for 3 nights on a weekend trip to Paris with my Father. We were travelling back from Jordan/Israel to the U.S. and the stop in Paris was just what we needed. This hotel is charming--not too large, not too small. The staff spoke perfect English and was very helpful when it came to accomodating this self-styled foodie's passion for eating "off the beaten path." The breakfast offering was just right--good for a light or a heary eater. The bathroom is large and the room itself generous with 2 large windows opening to a baloncy. The location is perfect--a short walk to the Champs-Elysee and the Eiffel Tower. The side street location is quiet and safe. I highly recommend this hotel. Enjoy Paris fellow Travellers!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: OlgaWashington
Reviews.Content: wonderful breakfast (though not cheap), spacious triple room, efficient staff, helpful receptionists, will certainly come back again

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with no "charme" and sour-faced staff”
Reviews.Author: siede
Reviews.Content: No smiles, except for the lady who brings breakfast in the morning. No charme. I would not stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: myz430i
Reviews.Content: The location is terrific The staff is friendly The breakfast is delicious and hours from 7am till noon The room is generous and comfortable The bathroom is all marble and the tub/shower is large Free internet on lower floors Great reading and relaxing rooms on entry level Very quiet Best restaurant for beef on opposite corner just North of hotel 5 minutes to abundant shopping-strolling 10 minutes to sites-strolling

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for quiet experience and personal service”
Reviews.Author: designit2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Paris with my two 17 year old neices. We spend 5 nights. The hotel is small and quiet, 24 hour employee at desk. Four blocks from Champs Elysees. Rooms overlooking the street a little noise at night (garbage pick up and Street cleaners). Staff eager and willing help you navigate your way, she even helped us book the Eiffel tower tickets on line as we gave her out information (online booking must be at lease 1 day ahead). We have been to Paris many times and have stayed here in 2001 for a few nights. Rooms comfortable and clean, bigger than average room in europe. We booked with easy cilck travel.com and had breakfast included! ($30/pp). P.S. in gerneral I do not recommend visiting any city that you would like to explore thes streets, architecture, museums and churches in the summer, it is most uncomfortable. We were lucky to have cool weather for the week.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and well located”
Reviews.Author: mcvm
Reviews.Content: A good and well located hotel. Good: concierge service and cleanliness. Standard rooms can be very tight: worth upgrade to a larger one. Pity: the breakfast, poor and without variety, poor breakfast service and staff very noisy, inattentive and, sometimes, almost rude, if possible avoid the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to Champs Elysees, on a quiet back street”
Reviews.Author: PatientX
Reviews.Content: The staff were terrific here. They were all very helpful. We were travling with our 2 children (10 and 6) so we had requested adjoining rooms. They only have 48 rooms so I was skeptical that we would, in Paris, be able to find adjoining rooms, but it worked out perfectly. Rooms 54 and 55 have a doorway in between. Our flight arrived at 730AM also, but our rooms were ready when we arrived. Rue Clement Merot is a short walk from the Champs Elysees and the Franklin Roosevelt Metro station. From there you can catch the yellow 1 Metro to the Tuileries, Louvre, Bastille, with bridge access from there to any quarter. The rooms were larger than I expected. They were just a bit dark, but only because there are heavy drapes which are helpful if you intend to sleep in. The rooms and bathrooms were clean and tidy. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet, which was included in our rate. They serve scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon, a type of ratatouille for on your eggs. Also, several cheeses, cold cuts, spreads, breads, croissants, rolls, crackers. Orange and pink grapefruit juice, canned fruit, fresh fruit, dried fruit, nuts, granola, cereals, milk, yoghurt, some sort of creamy yoghurt/cheese mixture (it was good). You order coffee or tea when you sit down. We had such nice breakfasts that we rarely ate more than a croissant or crepe for lunch. They do not offer dinner at the hotel and we did not visit the bar. The in-room food is quite expensive. E6 - 8 generally. A better option is to visit the little wine shop next door. They sell a large bottle of water for E1.80. There is also a small Supermarket around the corner (left out front door and first street to the right. down a block). Very convenient. The staff were very courteous and helpful, giving us directions a few times to diff places (to the RER to Versailles etc). Overall, it was a good choice. The large rooms, breakfast included, convenient Metro station, helpful staff, quiet location...Perhaps if you are wanting a hot and happening place you will choose a hotel directly on the Champs Elysees, but good luck getting the items listed above.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Playmates
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a romantic 4 day weekend at this hotel. The TravelZoo offer was fantastic. The hotel is located in the best part of town and the rooms are really nice. The bathroom was especially nice and large for European standards. The breakfast was extensive and very good. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel but dont use the bar - too expensive”
Reviews.Author: pleeathome
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, in a great situation 5 minutes from the Champs Elysee and the river and next to the fashionable shops on Avenue Montaigne. Helpful staff and very French. Lots of restaurants of different kinds nearby. Great walking position. Lovely breakfast room and breakfast. Rooms are average size and might be noisy on the street during summer but not at this time (February). Air conditioning didnt work due to it being switched off centrally but not a problem at this time of year. Not untypically the bar is ridiculously expensive (£44 for 2 gins and tonic and 2 glasses of wine) but expect that all over central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: timetogo010
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from a list given through an Air France Package. As others have stated, it's in a good location. The staff could not have been nicer. The first floor hosts the lobby, bar, breakfast room, and two sitting areas. All very nicely decorated and cosy. I requested a balcony, as that was very important to me. I was told the only one available was in a very small room. I didn't care, so we took it. I thought the room was a very decent size. Very nicely appointed and comfortable. The balcony had lovely flowers in the boxes, which made it even nicer. I would recommend this hotel, and hopefully will be returning this spring!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jo74london
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, the Staff are excellent and very friendly, and the hotel more than comfortable. Our plug sockets wouldn’t charge anything on arrival but the staff immediately came upstairs and sorted without complaint – was a simple fuse. Breakfast was ok, we had ours in room sitting at table with the French doors open listening to the buzz of Paris whilst packing on the last morning! Lots of cafes nearby for fresh coffee and breakfast though as an alternative. Close to Champs Elysees area and lots of fab restaurants nearby – although avoid Ratn the fancy looking Indian which is ludicrously overpriced for average Indian cuisine, make a reservation and take the time to go over to Le Florimond for authentic French cuisine hosted by fab staff. We took the Travelzoo offer 2 nights bed and breakfast incl a bottle of Chablis and a Seine river cruise for 2 people €284 all in – Fab value given the price of hotels in Paris. Would not have been so happy if paying €300 per night. Would recommend especially for location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, and location”
Reviews.Author: Hutch72
Reviews.Content: Super hotel break. Our room was a good size and had lovely decor. Staff friendly. Hotel lobby relaxing. Had a charming romantic appeal to it. This was a great location, only a coulpe of minutes walk to the Champs-Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: gibby30
Reviews.Content: Hotel Franklin D. Roosevelt is ideally located on the 'Right Bank'; close to the Champs Elysee; the Metro and between elegant Avenues Montaigne and George V. The Seine is within a short pleasant walk. There are numerous informal but excellent restaurants in the immediate environs. The Hotel is modest,comfortable and has a friendly and helpful staff. Although a 'Petit Dejeuner' is available it is a Buffet. A more modest 'Continental' breaksfast would be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: khadiJeddah
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the golden triangle Very nice rooms

Reviews.Title: “So convenient for the pedestrian tourist.”
Reviews.Author: DougySunderland
Reviews.Content: Hotel well situated for the visitor who does not want to spend their day on the metro system. Rooms are excellent, spotless and well serviced. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Bar and lounge are also excellent but give the rather expensive (25 euro), breakfast a miss. There are some very convenient places to eat within minutes walk. Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel Tower are within 10 - 15 mins walk, centre of Paris and the Louvre approx 20 - 25 mins walk. We will be going again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveling9
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be one of the worst I have ever stayed at. I found the staff to be extremely rude and unhelpful. My room was so noisy and found it very difficult to sleep. Paris was beautiful but this hotel was a huge disappointment. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very charming”
Reviews.Author: Parisjade
Reviews.Content: Overall, very happy with the location. Would definitely stay there again. Very clean and charming. Room was good size for Europe. Staff could have been a little more friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The best location 4 star hotel for central Paris”
Reviews.Author: PPGloucester
Reviews.Content: This isthe second time we have stayed at the hotel and it was excellent. Quiet and without the hub bub of lots of amenities. Very helpful staff (despite some awkward customers!). Room was well looked after and excellent. Location could not be better for the Champs Elysee area. Plenty of restaurants etc on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Weekendtraveler08
Reviews.Content: Right off the Champs Ellyse, close to wonderful shops, restaurants, etc., all within walking distance! Had a suite on the top floor and from our room could see the Eiffel Tower! Quiet, romantic, elegant, boutique-like, as the 6th floor (top floor) only had maybe five rooms! Breakfast was okay, but probably could find better just up the street, or across the street! Clean, spacious, with separate toilet and vanity/shower rooms. I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: abrtn89
Reviews.Content: The HR is fine for a small property-- might be best for travellers who know their way around Paris. There is room service mainly for breakfast, I think, but there are many many places to eat in the area, for every purse. Or you can go to Vignon on the corner and buy all manner of delicacies to take out, including a nice selection of champagne splits. The staff are fine-- no problems. They were patient with my improvised opera-house French. There are several Metro stops in walking distance-- you can easily get anywhere. My room was the suite on the top floor-- very quiet, clean and comfortable. I think if you need much hand-holding, perhaps this is not the place for you-- spend twice as much for the George V or Le Bristol if you need to-- but with a bit of self-reliance, this property can serve you very well as a base in Paris. I did not spend any time in t he lobby bar, but it seemed a tranquil place to unwind. It happened that I was out most every night at concerts. A bientot, HR!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very good restaurants around, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: mocreia
Reviews.Content: Would not have breakfast at the hotel as terribly overrated and there are plenty of good options around to beat the €23 charge which is excessive for what is offered

Reviews.Title: “Great Position”
Reviews.Author: luckytraveller49
Reviews.Content: Great position for sight seeing. We were able to walk around Paris from this hotel and easily visit major attractions and interesting areas. We found lots of places nearby for breakfast and dinner at night, including a starbucks for a decent cup ot tea in the morning! It's a pity that the hotel does not have any means of making a cup of tea/coffee in the rooms, that aside it was generally seemed to be a quiet part of the city overnight helping in a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: 2RichmondDoxies
Reviews.Content: Easy to book online. Very nice, very clean hotel. The location is excellent and I love the little bar downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and quiet, a hidden gem.”
Reviews.Author: ciarapoppy
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from spending 3 nights at this lovely, quaint little hotel. Only 40+ rooms, so very intimate and quiet and well tucked away from the hustle, yet centrally placed and easy to walk to most things. The decor is traditional and tasteful, the staff very helpful, and the breakfasts delicious. The rooms were large and spacious, with safe, good TV, well stocked mini-bar, and the added surprise of a jet bath was most welcome. All in all, a highly recommended hotel, and made for a delightful first trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt is one of our preferred hotels in Paris for 2 family generations”
Reviews.Author: Alex-Geneva-CH
Reviews.Content: excellent location, confortable rooms, which seem to have been recently renewed, nice breakfast and better price when compared with other 4 star hotels close by, which can offer a sophistaced & chic environ, but costly wise one can reflect if it is worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: cerulean1
Reviews.Content: I looked at many different hotel options. I do not mind paying more for a great location, service, etc. but I want the best deal. We loved this hotel. The location could not have been better. It was a couple of blocks from Champs Elysees, Eiffel Tower, fantastic shopping, metro and wonderful neighborhood bistros. The room was small but comfortable, great beds and a nice bathroom. The staff at the front desk was so helpful and friendly - not like most of the Parisians we met. This hotel was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Blanka Birthday”
Reviews.Author: BlankaBudapest
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the stay in your hotel - the room (triple) was small but tidy and friendly, I liked the atmosphere and the attitude of the staff: they were all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We had a winderful experience”
Reviews.Author: spidersuz
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 wonderful days in Paris at this hotel. Our room was exceptionally clean and quiet with a great bathroom. The breakfast each morning in the hotel was wonderful with fantastic pastries and many other choices. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is excellent - we walked to restaurants and attractions or took the Metro. We met another couple from the US in the restaurant across the street that said they have been coming back to this hotel for 5 years. We agree and would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AChakravarty
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 nights at the Franklin Roosevelt -- for 3 nights between 5-8th May and then 6 nights from 10th-16th May. We left our luggage with the hotel concierge when we visited Dijon for 2 nights and they were happy to keep it for us. We got Room 17 during our first 3 night stay. The room overlooked the inner courtyard. It was small but not cramped. The room is tastefully decorated, the beds are soft and we found the cooling satisfactory. There is a decent cupboard with a small safe. The rooms have flat screen TV with 5-6 french channels and English language news channels. However, the room does not have an ironing board, nor does it have any complimentary mineral water or tea/coffee maker. We paid 10 Euros for a pot of tea and some packed cakes served in our room. The ensuite bathroom was somewhat old-fashioned but it is clean. The baths are largesized and it is equipped with a hand shower. The hotel provides toiletries of reasonable quality, bath robe and hair-dryer. We got Room 34 during our second 6 night stay. This room was almost the same as the previous one, but it looked out onto the street. We had breakfast included in our package. It is good, but it is exactly the same every day. The breakfast includes tea/coffee, cakes/pastries, different kinds of breads (including excellent croissants), fresh fruit, yoghurts, cereals, dried fruits, orange/grapefruit/tomato juice, cheeses, smoked salmon, bacon, sausages, scrambled eggs, fried potatoes, 3-4 types of cold-cuts. Breakfast is open from 6:30 am to 10:30 am everyday. The hotel's USP is its location. It is just a 5 minute walk from Champs Elysees and from the Franklin Roosevelt Metro Station. A few minutes walk in the opposite direction will take you to Pont De'Alma from where the Bateaux Mouche service starts. The Amla Marceau Metro Station is right there and if you cross the bridge you will reach the Pont De'Alma RER station from where you can catch a train to Versailles (it takes about 30 minutes). Avenue Montaine, which houses all the top designer outlets is less than 5 minutes away from the hotel If you visit google earth and locate the hotel you will see how close it is to Eiffel Tower, Musee D'Orsay, Place de la Concorde, Arche de Triumphe. You can easily walk to the Louvre and even to Notre Dame if you are feeling energetic. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. They answered each of our queries very patiently -- helping us with directions, searching the net to take out information that we needed. All in all, we had a very pleasant experience. Please do not expect great luxury or the efficiency of a business hotel. Franklin Roosevelt is more a home away from home, which makes you feel comfortable despite all its flaws.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ecbmdpsych
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a small hotel, there's really nothing fancy about it. It was relatively well maintained and housekeeping was quite good and prompt. The breakfast was included in our package and it was a basic buffet breakfast with cold cut meats, hot items such as scrambled eggs and potato with sauteed tomato sauce and sausage. It also has cereals and fruits. The price was Euro 23, which is really overpriced, if I didn't have this included in our package, even if you pay me Euro 23, I would not have breakfast at this hotel because it was not worth the price for this meal. The airconditioning unit was never on the week we were there from 25 April to 2 May 2008. Thank goodness the weather was cool enough during that time in Paris not to have the airconditioning on. I suppose they were saving energy at the expense of the patrons. Also be very wary and extra cautious in leaving your money in their safe. We make it a point to lock the combination safe everyday but when we checked our cash supply the following morning, we were missing 5 US$100 bills. This is despite the fact that we were 100% sure the safe was locked when we left in the morning for our sight seeing around Paris. However, the smaller US$ denominations of a couple of 20s, 10s, 5s and a few 1 dollar bills though were surprisingly not taken. The only explanation is the hotel has the capability of bypassing our combination lock and opening the safe, which we think is what happened. The lesson here is check your money in the safe in the morning before you go out to do your touristy things and check it again when you return at the end of the day. Despite this, we tried not to get too upset about it and enjoyed our visit to Paris. If asked if I would stay in this hotel again? I would respond by saying I probably would but if its the summer, I'll ask them if the airconditioning is working, otherwise, if it's the colder months, then it's not a big deal if the unit is off. In fairness to this hotel, it is really convenient to the grandest avenue of Paris, Champs Elysees, the Metro and public transportation. We also felt quite safe in the immediate neighborhood of this hotel during our midnight and 1:00AM walks.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Khalilm
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in March at the Franklin Roosevelt hotel in Paris and I can guarantee the authenticity of this charming British style boutique hotel! I booked my stay with the Hotel directly through www.hotelrooms.com and got the best rate online. I stayed in a Deluxe room on the 5th floor with a very nice balcony overlooking a very quiet street. The hotel is located off the Champs-Elysees, the subway is 5 minutes walking!! The hotel is renovated and the room was an average of 30sqm but the best part was the balcony with a table overlooking the main street. I was on the 5th floor and had a nice view over the roof. The rooms is well furnished (a bit old) and the bathroom was functional. High pressure guaranteed in the bathtub and all amenities could be found. I didn't have time to try the breakfast but I had a look into the bkfst room and it worth the price. Other reviewers seem to like it! The best part was the staff: very welcoming and smiling. I had an issue with the air conditionning (making some noise) at 11 pm and they sent someone immediatly to my room to temporary fix it. The next day, when I came back to my room, the noise was definitely gone.. I highly recommend the Franklin Roosevelt hotel as one of the most charming British style Boutique hotels in Paris at a very inexpensive price...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in many ways...”
Reviews.Author: toldyaso
Reviews.Content: Our family of six stayed in two triple rooms for a week. While that was a bit cramped (we should have had three doubles), the rooms were very nice, great baths, but the staff is what was best of all. They were always smiling, helpful, and willing to endure our limited French or converse in our native English. We had lost luggage and they helped us continually until it finally showed up. The location is also excellent. Quiet street, but easily walkable to the Eiffel Tower, the Arc, or the Louvre. The RER to Notre Dame is just south across the river and the metro to everywhere else is just north. We visited many of the area restaurants and shops and the people there were also wonderful. Get to Paris, stay at the FR and have a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Oxon39
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Paris and we could not have wished for a better hotel. The staff were welcoming and friendly, and nothing was too much trouble for them. The rooms were a good size - ours had an enormous bed, despite being a "standard". Housekeeping was excellent. A superb location, tucked down a small side street, 200m from Les Champs Elisse, with a great selection of restaurants and cafes within easy reach. Ave George V is in the opposite direction and at the bottom of the road, Rue de Montaigne leads towards the Eiffel Tower. The cost of the buffet breakfast has just risen to 23 euros, so if you are able to get a price inclusive of breakfast, it's worth it - it is served from 7am - 12.30pm each day. My only criticism was the air conditioning in our room was faulty, and despite informing reception, remained so throughout our six-day stay. The rooms are overheated, and opening the windows can mean an icy blast.

Reviews.Title: “typical 4 star paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: halaman
Reviews.Content: Clean and renewed rooms. They upgrade us for a superior room. Rooms are not big, but this is paris!!! We don't mind because we had great time. Staff was helpfull and smiley. Location is ok. 200mt from champs elysees, between av montaigne and george V...in the middle of the triangle. next time i can stay at this hotel, only if i couldnt find room in chateau frontenac like this time. ozgur halaman

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: chearnaigh
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Paris (1st week of Sept) was outstanding. We stayed at the Hotel Franklin Roosevelt in the 8th arrondissement. The location was great, just a few blocks from the Champs Elysèe. The Arc de Triomphe is within walking distance and there is a Metro station close by, which makes it easy to to get to all of the great areas of Paris without a hassle. The hotel staff was courteous and helpful, language was never a problem, and we were able to check-in early. The room and bathroom were much larger than what we have learned to expect in Europe. One negative was the buffet breakfast. which was not included. At 22 Euros is was quite over-priced, but after the first day we found plenty of cafes in the immediate area to start off our day.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: mkent924
Reviews.Content: Searching for a hotel on line in Paris for myself, my wife, and 11 year old daughter proved to be a challenge. We wanted to avoid a small, stuffy, cramped room with dubious air conditioning in the middle of the summer. The Franklin Roosevelt, ideally located off the Champs de Elysses, had very good reviews. We found the reviews to be accurate. The hotel room was sizeable for Paris, the air conditioning was excellent with an in-room control, the beds were comfortable, and the bathroom was modern and spacious. The staff was accomodating, and, as most flights arrive from the US in the early AM, we were graciously given coffee while the staff prepared our room for an early check-in. There is a great gourment bakery/meat shop just two doors down, an excellent restaurant right across the street, and the location for sightseeing is superb. The staff speaks English, and I would recommend without hesitation this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in Paris near the Champs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: GreenBay_WITraveler2
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be in great location with easy access to the Metro. The staff was friendly and helpful. This was our first trip to Paris, and we wanted to see all the sites which we could do from this location. The rooms were as shown on the Web Site. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Tom & Pat, Green Bay, WI

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: longboard
Reviews.Content: We split our time in Paris between the Franklin and a Hotel in the Latin Quarter. We really liked the Franklin, the room was big, staff was very nice. The area was good to stay, close to shopping, eiffle tower and the Arc d Triumphe. Also went to the Crazy Horse show. Area is less busy than the Latin Quarter but we found it entertaining. There were several good cafes on the block where we ate. For the money this was the better of the 2 hotels we stayed in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Anglotraveller
Reviews.Content: Booked a "good buy" hotel using Travelocity. It was still expensive for what we ended up with. Rooms were well decorated by small. Great location but very quiet and wasn't the real Paris as mainly frequented by foreign businessmen and tourists. However, it is good for anyone who is visiting Paris for the first time. Concierge pretty useless.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Franklin D. Roosevelt
HotelInfo.Address: 18, rue Clement Marot | 08 Arr., 75008 Paris, France
